results.title: Journey in France
results.creator_credit: Gunther V. Fritsch and Churchill-Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: A picture of France seen through the eyes of the two daughters of a barge family as they travel the rivers and canals from Marseilles to Strasbourg. Presents a panorama of the history, geography, and economy of the country, and portrays the character of the French working people.

results.title: Journey from Zero
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Tim Wilson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A journey northward from Mile Zero, where the Alaska Highway begins, through mountain wilderness. This film covers the route of the travelling library van, a free book service of the Public Library Commission of British Columbia. To oil towns, army bases, mining camps and scattered settlements, the bookmobile delivers a wide assortment of reading material.

results.title: Journey from Etsa
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, David Bairstow, Ghana Government Film Unit and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The film presents a story of village life in Ghana, revealing the character and aspirations of the people of this new African nation. Through the patient persistence of young men of the village who seek to modernize ancient, unproductive ways of fishing, we glimpse the wish of a nation to rise to better things.

results.title: Journey for survival
results.creator_credit: Dick Young, UNICEF, United Nations Development Programme and World Health Organisation
results.brief_description: Examines how the provision of safe drinking water to impoverished nations was achieved in Ethiopia, Yemen, Peru, India, Bangladesh and the Philippines. Shows how small technology community action solutions tackle the problem of sanitation and an adequate, clean water supply.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dick Young, UNICEF, United Nations Development Programme and World Health Organisation

results.title: Jour de fete [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tati, Fred Orain and Francinex
results.brief_description: Jacques Tati’s award winning feature debut is an hilarious expose of the modern obsession with speed and efficiency, set amidst the rural surroundings of a tiny French village. The arrival of the summer fair brings a frenzy of activity as children, villagers and showmen bustle to cram as much as possible into twenty four fun-packed hours. But when the local postman attempts the high speed methods of the American mail service the villagers experience a new kind of madness. Also available on VHS [301871].

results.title: Joshua in a box
results.creator_credit: John Lange and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: An animated film which uses the situation of a boy being trapped in a box as a basis for a study of needs, emotions and values. No commentary, music and sound effects only.

results.title: Joshua and the shadow
results.creator_credit: John Lange, Kandi Lange, Joshua Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the way people react to themselves by telling a story in animation about a man who reacts to his shadow in many ways, from avoidance to aggression, until he discovers light, a tool with which he can control his shadow. Compares this to the tool of understanding, used to control emotional shadows. No commentary, music and sound effects only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Lange, Kandi Lange, Joshua Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions

results.title: Joshua and the blob
results.creator_credit: John Lange, Stephen Bosustow, Joshua Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the effect of external influences on a person’s thoughts and behaviour by telling about a person who reacts in various ways to a creature he does not understand. Shows that as his knowledge increases, his behaviour is more effective and his reactions more positive. Animated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Lange, Stephen Bosustow, Joshua Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions

results.title: Joseph Campbell and the power of myth. Episodes 4-6
results.creator_credit: David Grubin, Catherine Tatge, Apostrophe S Productions and Public Affairs Television
results.brief_description: The final three hours of interviews, conducted by Bill Moyers, with world authority on myth, Joseph Campbell, shortly before his death in 1987. Episode 4 - “Sacrifice and bliss” Campbell discusses the role of sacrifice as a necessity for rebirth and the need for each of us to find a sacred place in today’s modern world. Episode 5 - “Love and the goddess” Covers both the growth of romantic love associated with the 12th century troubadours and the worship of woman as goddess, earth mother and Virgin Mary. Episode 6 - “Masks of eternity” Campbell provides challenging insights into God, religion and eternity as revealed in Christianity, Buddhism, Native American Indian beliefs and the theories of Jung and Schopenhauer.
